title: Criticism of the Trinity, Incarnation, Atonement - Collection 5
description:
Criticism of the Trinity, Incarnation and Atonement - Collection 5:

We have 30 titles here:

-  Bicknell - The Christian Idea of Sin and Original Sin in the Light of Modern Knowledge (1922)

-  Birks - Difficulties of Belief in Connexion with the Creation and the Fall, Redemption and Judgment (1876)

-  Boyce - Born Bad; Original Sin and the Making of the Western World (2014)

-  Case - The Incarnation and Modern Thought (1908)

-  Chalamet & Vial (Eds.) - Recent Developments in Trinitarian Theology; an International Symposium (2014)

-  Davies & Turner - Silence and the Word, Negative Theology and Incarnation (2004)

-  Davis - The Redemption; an Interdisciplinary Symposium on Christ as Redeemer (2004)

-  Dixon - Nice and Hot Disputes; the Doctrine of the Trinity in the Seventeenth Century (2003)

-  Hill - Paul and the Trinity; Persons, Relations, and the Pauline Letters (2015)

-  Ingle-Gillis - The Trinity and Ecumenical Church Thought (2007)

-  Inwagen & Zimmerman - Persons; Human and Divine (2007)

-  Jacobs - Original Sin; a Cultural History (2008)

-  McCall & Rea (Eds.) - Philosophical & Theological Essays on the Trinity (2009)

-  McClelland - Encyclopedia of Reincarnation and Karma (2010)

-  Mulhall - Philosophical Myths of the Fall (2005)

-  Ottley - The Doctrine of the Incarnation, Vol. I, to the Council of Nicaea (1896)

-  Ottley - The Doctrine of the Incarnation, Vol. II, to the Present Day (1896)

-  Paine - The Ethnic Trinities and their Relations to the Christian Trinity (1901)

-  Phan (Ed.) - The Cambridge Companion to the Trinity (2011)

-  Pohle - Christology, a Dogmatic Treatise on the Incarnation (1916)

-  Polkinghorne - Science and the Trinity; the Christian Encounter with Reality (2004)

-  Rea (Ed.) - Oxford Readings in Philosophical Theology; Vol. 1, Trinity, Incarnation, and Atonement (2009)

-  Rea (Ed.) - Oxford Readings in Philosophical Theology; Vol. 2, Providence, Scripture, and Resurrection (2009)

-  Schlitt - Hegel's Trinitarian Claim; a Critical Reflection, 2e (2012)

-  Sigal - Trinity Doctrine Error; a Jewish Analysis (2006)

-  Smith - Changing Conceptions of Original Sin; a Study in American Theology since 1750 (1955)

-  Thondup - Incarnation; the History and Mysticism of the Tulku Tradition of Tibet (2011)

-  Volf - After Our Likeness; the Church as the Image of the Trinity (1998)

-  Wilson - Unitarian Principles Confirmed by Trinitarian Testimonies (1874)

-  Yandell - The Most Brutal and Inexcusable Error in Counting; Trinity and consistency, Religious Studies (June, 1994)
